description:
Nostoc punctiforme PCC 73102 is a species of cyanobacteria, a type of photosynthetic prokaryotic organism. It belongs to the genus Nostoc, which is known for its ability to form symbiotic relationships with various plants and fungi.

The strain PCC 73102 of Nostoc punctiforme was isolated from a soil sample and has been extensively studied in laboratory settings. It is a filamentous cyanobacterium that can form specialized cells called heterocysts, which are involved in nitrogen fixation, allowing the organism to thrive in nitrogen-limited environments.

Nostoc punctiforme PCC 73102 is a spherical or elliptical-shaped bacterium, typically ranging in size from 3 to 7 micrometers in diameter. It exhibits a distinctive blue-green color due to the presence of photosynthetic pigments, such as chlorophyll and carotenoids, within its cells.

This strain of Nostoc punctiforme has been used as a model organism in various research studies, particularly in the fields of symbiosis, nitrogen fixation, and the regulation of cellular differentiation. Its genetic and physiological characteristics have been extensively investigated, providing insights into the adaptations and metabolic processes of cyanobacteria.
